techmeme.title: Character.AI co-founders Noam Shazeer and Daniel De Freitas, and some employees, are joining Google; Google has signed a non-exclusive agreement to use its tech (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
The US DOJ sues TikTok, saying it collected children's data without parents' permission, knowingly let users under the age of 13 create accounts, and more (New York Times)
A look at Musk-backed America PAC's "Register to Vote" online campaign, which collects users' personal data in swing states, but does not help them register (Brian Schwartz/CNBC)
UK shelves promised £800M for Edinburgh University exascale supercomputer and £500M for AI Research Resource, saying former government never allocated the funds (Zoe Kleinman/BBC)
Google pulled an Olympics TV ad where a father uses Gemini to help his daughter write a personal letter to an athlete, after criticisms that the ad is tone-deaf (Asa Hiken/Ad Age)
